benchmark_details.name: EMScore (Embedding Matching-based score)
benchmark_details.overview: EMScore is a novel reference-free metric for video captioning, which directly measures similarity between video and candidate captions. It combines matching scores of both coarse-grained (video and caption) and fine-grained (frames and words) levels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a reference-free metric for evaluating video captions that better aligns with human judgment.

data.source: Datasets collected include VATEX-EVAL and ActivityNet-FOIL.
data.annotation: Human ratings by annotators on a scale of 1 to 5.

methodology.calculation: EMScore is calculated as the average of coarse-grained and fine-grained embedding matches.
methodology.interpretation: Higher EMScore indicates a better quality caption, reflecting its consistency with the video.
methodology.baseline_results: EMScore shows higher human correlation than existing metrics like BLEU, ROUGE, and CIDEr.
methodology.validation: V ATEX-EVAL and ActivityNet-FOIL datasets were used for validation.
